premise: a fetus is more separate from the mother than other collections of cells inside her body
state should limit itself to forcing most minimal sacrifices, not exceptionally great sacrifices of free will like enduring pregnancy
comments: more heuristic for policymaking than provable cause-effect

premise: the more significant a societally-forced sacrifice, the higher the likelihood of unnecessary suffering
not comfortable with any government-forced manipulation on a decision with such a localized area of effect
my personal focus with regards to abortion is to avoid inducing a pregnancy that is likely to end in an abortion
I should accept possibility of being a parent when risking pregnancy
I should not assume the potential mother is comfortable with enduring pregancy
abortion bans are likely to restrict access to necessary healthcare
